Event: ... feeling different than the person you were in High School, feeling like a dick, never wanting to hangout with friends, feeling distant and uninterested during social interactions, wanting to be yourself again, feeling lost.
Post: "I've changed so much since high school. I used to be popular and outgoing, but now I feel like a completely different person. I'm constantly feeling like a fraud and struggling to connect with my friends. I'm always declining invitations to hangout because I just don't feel like myself anymore. I'm distant and disinterested during social interactions, and I desperately want to be my old self again. I feel lost and unsure of who I am or where I belong."

Event: Suffering from depression for 4 years, feeling worse over time, lack of affection and support from parents, bullying, and struggles with grades and self-esteem.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression for 4 years, and it feels like I'm drowning in a sea of hopelessness. My parents don't understand me, they never have. They don't care about my feelings or my well-being. I've been bullied and belittled by my peers, and I can't seem to catch a break. My grades are slipping, and my self-esteem is non-existent. I feel like I'm a failure, and that I'll never amount to anything. #depression #anxiety #failure"

Event: Told one of my best friends that I had feelings for her and she told me that she was already thinking of dating someone else.
Post: "I confessed my feelings to my best friend, but she rejected me and now I'm doomed to be alone forever."

Event: Imagining harming oneself, feeling depressed and unmotivated, lying to a parent, and experiencing a loss of interest in a previously enjoyed activity (swimming).
Post: "I'm such a failure. I can't even enjoy the things I used to love anymore, like swimming. And to make matters worse, I've been lying to my parents about how I'm doing. I just feel so lost and unmotivated all the time. It's like everything in my life is going wrong and I can't do anything right. Even thinking about harming myself sometimes feels like the only escape from this never-ending cycle of sadness and disappointment."

Event: Getting shelter or government form of shelter.
Post: "I'm so grateful to have finally found a place to call my own! 🏠😊 It's not just a roof over my head, it's a fresh start and a new chapter in my life. I'm excited to see where this new journey takes me! 🌟 #blessed #shelter #newbeginnings"

Event: My girlfriend broke up with me on Christmas.
Post: "My girlfriend breaking up with me on Christmas means that I'm unlovable and will never have a successful relationship. It's just another example of how I always manage to mess things up."

Event: The main event in this text is the death of the author's sister, who was killed in a car accident on Christmas day. The author also mentions the loss of their aunt, grandfather, and the struggle with depression and feeling used by everyone they thought they could trust.
Post: "I can't believe my sister is gone. She was taken from me on Christmas day, and it feels like my whole world has been turned upside down. I keep thinking about how this one event is going to affect every aspect of my life. I'll never be able to trust anyone again, and I'll always feel like I'm drowning in a sea of sadness. My aunt and grandfather are also gone, and it feels like I've lost everything that ever mattered to me. I'm just a shell of the person I used to be, and I don't know how to move on from this pain. #sister #grief #loss"

Event: My sister took her life.
Post: "My sister took her life, which means I'm probably destined for a life of misery and tragedy."

Event: Feeling inadequate and unhappy with one's current situation, particularly in comparison to others, including family members.
Post: "I can't believe I'm still stuck in this dead-end job while my friends are all successful and living their best lives. I'll never be able to catch up to them."

Event: The individual is experiencing a lack of emotions (feeling "shitty" for years), their parent(s) have been diagnosed with cancer, and they are struggling in school (grades are slipping).
Post: "I'm feeling hopeless and lost. I've been feeling shitty for years, my parents have cancer, and I'm failing school. It seems like everything in my life is falling apart and I can't do anything right."

Event:
Losing best friend

Explanation: The main event in the passage is the loss of the speaker's best friend. This event is mentioned multiple times throughout the passage and is the primary source of the speaker's distress and feelings of grief. The event is described as a tragic death, with the friend jumping off a popular suicide spot, which adds to the drama and impact of the event. The speaker is left with many unanswered questions and regrets about not being able to help their friend before they died.
Post: "I'm still reeling from the loss of my best friend. It feels like a part of me has been torn away. I keep thinking about all the what-ifs and regrets. If only I had been there for them more, if only I had listened more closely, maybe they would still be here. But now they're gone, and I'm left with this aching void in my heart. It's hard to see a future without them in it. I feel like I'll never be able to find another friend like them, someone who truly understood me. It's like a part of my life has been permanently erased. I'll always miss them."

Event: Her girlfriend left for an internship in another country for 6 months, causing the writer to feel lonely, sad, and insecure about their relationship.
Post: "My girlfriend left me for an internship in another country, and now I'm feeling like a complete failure in life. I'll probably never find anyone else who loves me, and even if I do, they'll just leave me again. It's like the universe is conspiring against me to make me miserable. #heartbroken #insecure #failure"

Event: The person rejected the speaker's efforts to help them, causing emotional distress and doubt about the speaker's ability to trust others in the future.
Post: "I tried to help someone, but they rejected my efforts and now I'm feeling emotionally drained and doubting my ability to trust others. It seems like everything I do ends in failure and rejection."

Event: A letter was given and deleted, a year after the writer left the place where they spent time with the person who gave them the letter.
Post: "I can't believe I never heard from them after they left. It's like they disappeared without a trace, taking all my hopes and dreams with them. A whole year has passed, and I'm still stuck in this rut, unable to move on. It's like the universe is conspiring against me, ensuring that I'll always be alone and unfulfilled."

Event: getting close to someone too fast.
Post: "I got too close to someone too fast, which means I'm probably going to get hurt again. I always mess things up in my relationships. 😔 #failure #relationshipgoals"

Event: Getting in love and feeling hurt and betrayed due to mixed messages and eventual heartbreak.
Post: "I thought I found the one, but it turns out they were just playing me all along. I'm such a failure in love, and I'll never find anyone who truly cares about me."

Event: got pissed and threw the controller and stormed back to my room, my mom's solution tell me I'm worthless and she's tired of my crap & shove my dog outside (which is the only thing that gives me happiness)

She even took away the one thing that brings me joy - my dog. It seems like everything in my life is going wrong and I'm never going to be happy."

Event:
The person is experiencing a range of negative emotions and thoughts, including depression, anxiety, loneliness, and suicidal ideation. They have lost interest in their usual activities, are struggling with sleep and social interactions, and feel hopeless about their future.

The event can be traced back to the breakup of a long-distance relationship, which has triggered a chain of negative thoughts and emotions. The person is struggling to come to terms with the end of the relationship and is experiencing feelings of regret, self-blame, and uncertainty about their future. They are also grappling with issues of identity and self-worth, feeling unpopular and isolated.

The event has had a significant impact on the person's mental health, causing them to feel overwhelmed and helpless. They are struggling to concentrate and complete their school work, and are experiencing a lack of motivation and interest in their usual activities. The person is also experiencing physical symptoms such as acne and feelings of ugliness.

Overall, the event has caused significant emotional distress and disruption to the person's daily life. It is important for the person to seek support and professional help to address these issues and work towards a brighter future.
Post: "I'm a failure in every aspect of my life. I can't even keep a relationship going, let alone achieve my academic goals. I'm unpopular, isolated, and feel like I'm stuck in this rut forever. My future looks bleak, and I don't know how to get out of this hole. I'm losing interest in everything, and my mental health is deteriorating rapidly. I'm a burden to everyone around me, and I just want to disappear. #failure #hopeless #depression"
